conclusion: The detector moves along the positive x-axis from the origin O, and its velocity is inversely proportional to its displacement. At point A, velocity = 4 m/s; at point B, velocity = 2 m/s; displacement from O to B is 2 m.
The velocity equation is set up as v = k/x, where v is velocity, x is displacement, and k is a constant of proportionality.
Using point B (v = 2 m/s, x = 2 m), the constant k is calculated as k = 4.
Using point A (v = 4 m/s), the displacement x_A is calculated as x_A = 1 m.
Point A is at x = 1 m and point B is at x = 2 m along the positive x-axis, as shown in the figure.
The time calculation is set up as t = ∫(dx/v) = ∫(x/4) dx from x_A = 1 to x_B = 2.
The integral is calculated as t = (1/4) ∫(x dx) = (1/4) [(x^2)/2] from 1 to 2.
The integral result is t = (1/4) * (2 - 0.5) = (1/4) * 1.5 = 3/8 seconds.
The final answer is t = 0.375 seconds (or 3/8 seconds).
